title: Néstor Ortigoza
text:
Néstor Ezequiel Ortigoza (; born 7 October 1984) is an Argentine, naturalized Paraguayan <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="central%20midfielder">central midfielder</a>, who currently plays for <a href="San%20Lorenzo%20de%20Almagro">San Lorenzo de Almagro</a>.
Club career.
Ortigoza started his career in 2004, playing for Argentinos Juniors. In 2005, he had a brief loan spell with <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Nueva%20Chicago">Nueva Chicago</a> before returning to Argentinos. In 2007, he began to establish himself as an important member of the first team squad and in 2009 he became a near permanent fixture in the first team squad after the appointment of <a href="Claudio%20Borghi%20%28football%20manager%29">Claudio Borghi</a> as the manager of Argentinos Juniors.
Ortigoza was an important member of the Argentinos Juniors team that won the <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Argentine%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20season%23Torneo%20Clausura">Clausura 2010</a> championship. He played in 17 of the club's 19 games and scored 3 goals during their championship winning campaign been their captain and was selected Footballer of the Year in Argentina.
In 2011, <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20San%20Lorenzo%20de%20Almagro">San Lorenzo</a> bought the entire move from <a href="Argentinos%20Juniors">Argentinos Juniors</a> for $2,200,000 and signed the player for three seasons.
In July 2012, Ortigoza signed a one-year loan contract with <a href="Emirates%20Club">Emirates Club</a> in the United Arab Emirates.
In December 2017, Ortigoza signed with <a href="Rosario%20Central">Rosario Central</a> from <a href="Club%20Olimpia">Olimpia</a>.
After a half year at <a href="Estudiantes%20de%20R%C3%ADo%20Cuarto">Estudiantes de Río Cuarto</a>, it was rumored that Ortigoza had moved to Bolivian club <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Cicl%C3%B3n">Club Atlético Ciclón</a> in September 2020. However, this wasn't true and Ortigoza stayed at Estudiantes.
International career.
Ortigoza's father is Paraguayan, meaning that the <a href="Paraguay%20national%20football%20team">Paraguay national football team</a>'s coach <a href="Gerardo%20Martino">Gerardo Martino</a> had the interest of Ortigoza playing for the <a href="Paraguay%20national%20football%20team">Paraguay national team</a> due to Ortigoza is entitled to request Paraguayan citizenship.
On 8 April 2009 he obtained Paraguayan nationality, which enabled him to play for the <a href="Paraguay%20national%20football%20team">Paraguay national team</a>.
Ortigoza was called to the <a href="Paraguay%20national%20football%20team">Paraguay national football team</a> for the Qualification matches against <a href="Venezuela%20national%20football%20team">Venezuela</a> and <a href="Colombia%20national%20football%20team">Colombia</a>. He played in the World Cup 2010 in South Africa. On 14 October 2014, he scored his first goal in a 1–2 friendly away defeat against <a href="China%20national%20football%20team">China</a>.
Style of play.
Néstor Ortigoza is known for stocky, physical build, and his ability to win the ball as a central midfielder. His range of distribution and his slow-paced, intelligent, precise passing game also enable him to influence games from <a href="Midfielder%23Deep-lying%20playmaker">deeper positions in midfield</a>, where he can set the tempo of his team's play and orchestrate attacking moves. He is also a <a href="Penalty%20kick%20%28association%20football%29">penalty kick</a> specialist.
